name: A. Turtle and Good Strings
statement:
Turtle thinks a string s is a good string if there exists a sequence of
strings t_1, t_2,
ldots, t_k (k is an arbitrary integer) such that: k
ge 2. s = t_1 + t_2 +
ldots + t_k, where + represents the concatenation operation. For
example,
texttt{abc} =
texttt{a} +
texttt{bc}. For all 1
le i < j
le k, the first character of t_i the last character of t_j. Turtle is
given a string s consisting of lowercase Latin letters. Please tell him
whether the string s is a good string!
solutions: #include <bits/stdc++.h> #define ranges std::ranges#define views std::views using u32 = unsigned;using i64 = long long;using u64 = unsigned long long; using pii = std::pair<int, int>;using a3 = std::array<int, 3>;using a4 = std::array<int, 4>; const int N = 1e6;const int MAXN = 1e6 + 10;const int inf = 1e9;// const int mod = 1e9 + 7;const int mod = 998244353; void solve() {    int n;std::cin >> n;    std::string s;std::cin >> s;    std::cout << (s.front() == s.back() ? "NO" : "YES");} signed main() {    std::ios::sync_with_stdio(false);    std::cin.tie(0), std::cout.tie(0);    int t;std::cin >> t;    while (t--) {        solve();        std::cout << '\n';    }    return 0;}
hint: Hint The first character of isn't equal to the last character of .
